ðŸš€ tlock | Go
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Encrypting data that can only be decrypted after a specific future round on the drand network, ensuring future access without relying on a single party's availability.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Timelock Encryption/Decryption â€¢ Go library and `tle` command-line tool â€¢ Relies on drand threshold network for future decryption â€¢ Support for mainnet and testnet drand chains â€¢ Option for armor encoding
ðŸ“– Summary: The tlock Go library and `tle` CLI tool enable practical timelock encryption, allowing data to be encrypted today but only decrypted at a future, predetermined time. It leverages the drand threshold network for secure and verifiable time-based decryption keys.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ browsr | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Navigating and exploring local and remote file systems directly from the terminal with a rich user interface.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Terminal-based file explorer (TUI) â€¢ Supports local and remote file systems â€¢ Integrates with GitHub, SSH, AWS S3, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob Storage â€¢ Syntax highlighting for code files â€¢ JSON formatting
ðŸ“– Summary: Browsr is a terminal-based file explorer that allows users to navigate and interact with local and remote file systems. It supports various cloud storage services and offers features like syntax highlighting, JSON formatting, and data table rendering.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ relay | PHP
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: To provide developers with a self-hosted, open-source email sending API that offers control over infrastructure and data, serving as a cost-effective and customizable alternative to cloud-based email services.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Self-Hosted deployment via Docker â€¢ Email API for sending emails â€¢ Health checks for performance and deliverability â€¢ Logs and SMTP conversation viewing â€¢ Multi-tenancy and project management
ðŸ“– Summary: Hyvor Relay is an open-source, self-hosted email API that allows developers to send emails using their own infrastructure. It provides a robust alternative to commercial email services like SES, Mailgun, and SendGrid, offering features for managing deliverability, logs, and multi-tenancy.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ coralnpu | Emacs Lisp
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Energy-efficient machine learning inference acceleration for ultra-low-power edge devices.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ RV32IMF_Zve32x RISC-V instruction set â€¢ 32-bit address space â€¢ Four-stage processor, in-order dispatch, out-of-order retire â€¢ Four-way scalar, two-way vector dispatch â€¢ 128-bit SIMD pipeline
ðŸ“– Summary: Coral NPU is an open-source, energy-efficient hardware accelerator IP designed for machine learning inference, particularly for ultra-low-power edge devices like wearables. It is based on the RISC-V ISA and features specialized matrix, vector, and scalar processing units.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ nanobrowser | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: AI-powered web automation and multi-agent workflows directly within the browser.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Multi-agent System â€¢ Interactive Side Panel â€¢ Task Automation â€¢ Follow-up Questions â€¢ Conversation History
ðŸ“– Summary: Nanobrowser is an open-source Chrome extension that enables AI-powered web automation through multi-agent workflows. It acts as a privacy-focused, free alternative to tools like OpenAI Operator, allowing users to leverage their own LLM API keys for flexible and transparent browser automation.
